title: Rob Gronkowski FaceTimed Tom Brady while interviewing Drake Maye
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "Keep it up my man.
" Tom Brady and Rob Gronkowski after winning Super Bowl XLIX in 2015.

AP Photo/Kathy Willens, File By Hayden Bird October 27, 2025 | 11:08 AM 3 minutes to read Rob Gronkowski brought Drake Maye and Tom Brady together: With the Patriots once again thriving — now 6-2 under the burgeoning leadership of Drake Maye — New England fans could be forgiven for comparing the success to the Tom Brady era.

title: Duck hunter finds human remains near Merrimack River in N.H.
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News State and local police are investigating.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
New Hampshire State Police are investigating after a duck hunter found decomposed human remains in Merrimack, New Hampshire, on Sunday morning.

title: ‘Swag-less at times’: Mike Vrabel joked about Drake Maye, defended Will Campbell, discussed NFL trade deadline
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Patriots "It hasn't even left his hand yet and everybody's like, 'Touchdown!
Touchdown!
' I was like [let's] hold our horses.

title: One dead in Methuen wrong-way crash
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News A driver hit a tractor trailer head-on on I-495 Sunday morning, according to Massachusetts State Police.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
One driver is dead after a wrong-way crash in Methuen on Sunday.

title: Think you know everything about the Salem Witch Trials? Take our quiz.
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Quizzes Put your knowledge to the test of Witch City’s history, including key players and places of the 1692 trials.
Salem Witch Trials.

title: What Christian Gonzalez said about shutting down Jerry Jeudy
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "That's what I want to do and what any corner wants to do," Christian Gonzalez and Jerry Jeudy AP Photo/Charles Krupa FOXBOROUGH — The Patriots held Browns receiver Jerry Jeudy without a catch on Sunday.
Jeudy had just two targets and was unable to haul either one in.
The 2020 first-round pick enjoyed his first 1,000-yard season last year, catching 90 passes for 1,229 yards and four touchdowns.

title: 18-year-old killed, 2 people injured in Plymouth crash
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Local News Matthew Wilson, 18, was unresponsive when he was pulled from his car and pronounced dead at a hospital, the DA said.
An 18-year-old man was killed and two other people were injured in a crash in Plymouth on Friday, the local district attorney announced.
Plymouth police received a call about a serious vehicle crash at 129 State Rd.

title: 2 workers killed in crane collapse at Everett construction site
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News "It devastates us that our members and their families were impacted by this unfortunate incident," the Pile Drivers and Divers Local 56 union said.
The crane collapse in Everett prompted a wide response from police, fire officals, and EMS.
Jonathan Wiggs/The Boston Globe Two workers were killed Friday after a crane collapsed at an industrial job site in Everett.

title: Stefon Diggs finally gets ‘long overdue’ first touchdown with Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Diggs scored on a one-yard pass during the blowout victory.
Stefon Diggs celebrates after scoring a Patriots touchdown against the Browns.
AP Photo/Charles Krupa Stefon Diggs finally scored his first touchdown in a Patriots uniform eight weeks into the season on a one-yard pass from Drake Maye.

title: Why Mike Vrabel changed decades-long Bill Belichick tradition at Gillette Stadium
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "You always see other teams do it.
I've got literally no swag, so I just go out there and run.

" (AP Photo/Charles Krupa) By Conor Ryan October 26, 2025 | 7:18 PM 2 minutes to read FOXBOROUGH — The New England Patriots took the field at Gillette Stadium with the familiar arena anthem of Ozzy Osbourne’s “Crazy Train” blaring through the arena.
